article:

| name = Aditya 'Romeo' Dev
|alias = Aditya Kumar (Mitthu)
| image = birth_date = birth_place = Phagwara, India death_date = death_place =
| Jalandhar, India occupation = Body builder, entertainer, dancer salary =
| 40,000 pm networth = fev_city = Patna
}} 'Aditya 'Romeo' Dev' (1 November 1988 – 13 September 2012) was an
Indian body builder, entertainer and dancer with dwarfism made famous by being
reported in the British press in February 2008. [htt-
p://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2008/02/12/wromeo112.xml Romeo
Dev, the world's smallest bodybuilder - Telegraph ] Romeo could shoulder press custom made 2 kg dumbbells, a notable
feat given his 9 kg (20 lbs.) body weight and 84 cm (2' 9")
stature. [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/arti-
cles/news/worldnews.html?in_article_id=513820&in_page_id=1811 Mini-muscleman:
Meet the world's smallest bodybuilder | the Daily Mail ] Although it has not been published in a Guinness World Records book,
in 2006 they recognized him to be the "world's smallest bodybuilder".

Romeo had a head of 38 cm (15 inches) and a chest of 51 cm
(20 inches). He maintained his figure by working with his trainer Ranjeet
Pal. [http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,330460,00.html FOXNews.com -
World's Smallest Bodybuilder, Aditya 'Romeo' Dev of India, Causing Huge Stir -
International News | News of the World | Middle East News | Europe News ]

Dev made many appearances on local television to demonstrate his dancing
abilities.

In summer of 2008, Dev was diagnosed with aneurysms which, if left untreated,
are a serious threat to his life. Aneurysms and Moyamoya are common symptoms of
the syndrome MOPD II, which was the cause of Dev's small stature.

He died on 13 September 2012 after a brain aneurysm rupture.
